title: The Portrait of a Lady - response to this appearan

content.question: The account of Mrs. Touchett’s response to “this appearance” mentioned in the eleventh sentence (“It had become clear . . . realm of accident”) indicates that she

choices.label: would rather live alone than sacrifice her independence
would rather avoid speaking than risk provoking Mr. Touchett
prefers a state of perpetual alienation to a shared life with its unpredictable conflicts
desires to promote a sense of harmony through a candid discussion of differences

content.answer: prefers a state of perpetual alienation to a shared life with its unpredictable conflicts

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Identify and describe what specific textual details reveal about a character, that character's perspective, and that character's motives.
